docs.title: About
docs.text: CRI FileSystem V2 Hook is a mod based on Reloaded II that allows you to add/replace files in games that use CRI Middleware and the CPK container.

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
This universal mod targets x64 versions of games using CRI MiddleWare's V2 File System built with MSVC compiler. Work is based on CRI File System/PCx64 Ver.2.81.6 Build:Dec 28 2021 11:03:45. Other versions close to this version will likely work, but there's no guarantee.

Currently it is known to work on the following applications.

  • Persona 5 Royal
  • Persona 4 Golden Remaster Edition (2022, a.k.a. P4G64)
  • Sonic Frontiers

docs.title: Additional Features
docs.text:
• Hot Reload (Add/Replace files without app restart).
  • API (dynamically add files, set probing paths, etc.)
  • Log files accessed by application.
  • Replace music in AWB files inside CPKs without using additional disk space, via an extension mod.

docs.title: Building
docs.text:
• Install Reloaded II.
  • Install .NET 7 SDK.
  • [Optional] Download Visual Studio/Rider and open the .sln file.

When you build your project, the files will automatically be copied to the right directory and be loaded by Reloaded. Refer to the Reloaded wiki if you need more information.

docs.title: About
docs.text:
Info

CriFsHook has an extension mod that allows you to replace music inside AWB Containers.

docs.title: Set Dependency on AWB Extension
docs.text: In the Edit Mod menu (right click your mod in mods list) we're going to add AWB Emulator Support for CRI FileSystem V2 Hook as a dependency.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Please refer to FileEmulationFramework wiki.

Note

You can skip adding dependency on AWB emulator, do follow rest of guide though.

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
As per usage guide above.

Tip

If game uses encryption on audio, you might need to encrypt your music with same keys in some cases.

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
Warning

If the game uses an .acb file alongside the AWB, this mod assumes that the .acb will be named the same as the AWB, i.e. BGM.acb is used with BGM.awb.

If this is not the case, consider contributing to the project with an additional API 😇.

docs.title: Create a Reloaded Mod
docs.text: Follow the guidance in the Reloaded wiki to create a new Reloaded mod.

docs.title: Download Mod
docs.text: If you don't have it already, download the CRI FileSystem V2 Hook Mod from GitHub or Download Mods section.

docs.title: Set Dependency on CRI FS V2 Hook
docs.text:
In the Edit Mod menu (right click your mod in mods list) we're going to add CRI FileSystem V2 Hook as a dependency.

Adding a 'dependency' to your mod will make it such that P5R Essentials will always be loaded when your mod is loaded. This is a necessary step.

docs.title: Replacing files in CPKs
docs.text: Files inside CPKs can be replaced by creating a folder called CRIFsV2Hook/CPK in your mod, and adding folders corresponding to the names of the CPKs inside those folders.

docs.title: Opening the Mod Folder
docs.text: Go to the folder where your mod is stored, this can be done by simply clicking the Open Folder button.

docs.title: Add Some Files
docs.text:
Make a folder called CRIFsV2Hook, and inside that a folder called CPK. Inside that folder, make a folder [or multiple!] where you will store your mod files (you can call it anything you want!).

I used EN.CPK for clarity to match the game's structure.

We will replace these two files to enable different button prompts 😇.

The contents of our mod folder would now look as follows.

// Mod Contents
ModConfig.json
Preview.png
CRIFsV2Hook
└─CPK
  └─EN.CPK
    └─BUTTON
      ├─BUTTON_XBOX.PAK
      └─BUTTONXBOXTEXINFO.DAT

The connectors └─ represent folders.

docs.title: Releasing/Uploading your Mods
docs.text:
Please refer to the Reloaded wiki, and follow the guidance.

You should both Enable Update Support AND Publish according to the guidelines.

It is recommended to enable update support even if you don't plan to ship updates as doing so will allow your mod to be used in Mod Packs.
